items.title: The Dark Knight
items.comment: A masterclass in storytelling and character development. Heath Ledger's Joker remains one of cinema's most compelling villains, and the film's exploration of chaos vs. order is as relevant today as ever.

items.title: How to Get Startup Ideas
items.comment: Paul Graham's timeless advice on finding startup ideas by solving problems you have yourself. The best ideas often come from noticing things that are missing in your own life.

items.title: Building Products Users Love
items.comment: An insightful talk on product development and user-centric design. The speaker breaks down how to really understand your users and build something they'll actually use and recommend.

items.title: The Hard Thing About Hard Things by Ben Horowitz
items.comment: The most honest book about entrepreneurship I've read. Horowitz doesn't sugarcoat the challenges of running a company â€” from layoffs to tough decisions. Essential reading for anyone building a business.

items.title: Naval's How to Get Rich (without getting lucky)
items.comment: One of the most valuable Twitter threads ever written. Naval distills wealth creation into actionable principles. I revisit this regularly and always find new insights.

items.title: Building in Public with Indie Hackers
items.comment: Great conversation about transparency in business. The guest shares their journey building a SaaS product completely in public, including revenue numbers and challenges.

items.title: Obsidian
items.comment: The best note-taking app I've ever used. Markdown-based, local-first, and the graph view helps me connect ideas in ways I never could with traditional notes. Game-changer for knowledge management.
